   20: %%% Purpose : Test records.
   21: 
   22: -module(record_no_ssa_opt_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 errors/1,record_test_2/1,record_test_3/1,record_access_in_guards/1,
   30: 	 guard_opt/1,eval_once/1,foobar/1,missing_test_heap/1,
   31: 	 nested_access/1,coverage/1,grab_bag/1,slow_compilation/1]).
   32: 
   33: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   34:     Config.
   35: 
   36: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   37:     ok.
   38: 
   39: suite() ->
   40:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   41:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   42: 
   43: all() -> 
   44:     [{group,p}].
   45: 
   46: groups() -> 
   47:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   48:       [errors,record_test_2,record_test_3,
   49:        record_access_in_guards,guard_opt,eval_once,foobar,
   50:        missing_test_heap,nested_access,coverage,grab_bag,
   51:        slow_compilation]}].
   52: 
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     _ = id(Config),                  %Make return value unpredicatble.
   56:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: 
   69: -record(foo, {a,b,c,d}).
   70: -record(bar, {a,b,c,d}).
   71: -record(barf, {a,b,c,d,e}).
   72: 
   73: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Foo = #foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4},
   75:     #foo{a=19,b=42,c=3,d=4} = update_foo(Foo, 19, 42),
   76: 
   77:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19)),
   78:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35)),
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   81: 
   82:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19)),
   83:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35)),
   84:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   85:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   86:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Foo},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19,
   87:                                                           35, 17, 42, -2)),
   88: 
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: update_foo(#foo{}=R, A, B) ->
   92:     R#foo{a=A,b=B}.
   93: 
   94: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A) ->
   95:     R#bar{a=A}.
   96: 
   97: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
   98:     R#bar{a=A,b=A}.
   99: 
  100: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  101:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  102: 
  103: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  104:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  105: 
  106: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A) ->
  107:     R#barf{a=A}.
  108: 
  109: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  110:     R#barf{a=A,b=A}.
  111: 
  112: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  113:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  114: 
  115: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  116:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  117: 
  118: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D, E) ->
  119:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D,e=E}.
  120: 
  121: 
  122: -define(TrueGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ok; true -> ct:fail(failed) end).
  123: -define(FalseGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ct:fail(failed); true -> ok end).
  124: 				
  125: record_test_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  127:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  128:     false = is_record({foo}, foo),
  129: 
  130:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  131:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  132:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo),
  133: 
  134:     false = is_record([], foo),
  135:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  136: 
  137:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  138:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  139:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo)),
  140: 
  141:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  142:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  143:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  144: 
  145:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo)),
  146:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo)),
  147: 
  148:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  149: 
  150:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  151:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  152:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo)),
  153: 
  154:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  155:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  156:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  157: 
  158:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  159:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo)),
  160:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf)),
  161: 
  162:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo)),
  163: 
  164:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo)),
  165:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo)),
  166: 
  167:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  168: 
  169:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  170:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  171:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  172: 
  173:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  174:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  175:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  176: 
  177:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  178:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  179: 
  180:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo)),
  181:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo)),
  182: 
  183:     %% The optimizer attempts to move expressions to guards,
  184:     %% but it must not move an is_record/2 call that is not
  185:     %% allowed in a guard in the first place.
  186: 
  187:     ok = case is_record(id({a}), id(a)) of
  188: 		   true -> ok;
  189: 		   false -> error
  190: 	       end,
  191: 
  192:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  193: 
  194:     False = id(false),
  195:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo) xor False),
  196:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf) xor False),
  197:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo) xor False ),
  198: 
  199:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo) xor False),
  200:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf) xor False),
  201: 
  202: 
  203:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  204: 
  205:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  206: 
  207:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo)],
  208:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar)],
  209:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  210: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar)],
  211:     [1,3,5,7] =
  212: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar)) and (not is_record(X, foo)))],
  213:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  214: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (is_record(X, foo)))],
  215:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  216: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (X < 5))],
  217: 
  218:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  219:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo)],
  220:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo)],
  221:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo) end],
  222:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo) end],
  223:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or
  224: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  225:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  226: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  227:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  228:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  229: 			     is_reference(X)],
  230:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  231: 				   begin is_record(X, foo) or
  232: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  233:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  234: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  235: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  236:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  237: 			begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end],
  238:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  239: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  240: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  241: 
  242:     Map = id(#{a => 1, b => #foo{a=2}, c => 3, d => #bar{d=4},
  243:                e => 5, f => #foo{a=6}, h => 7}),
  244:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, foo)]),
  245:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || _ := X <- Map, is_record(X, bar)],
  246:     [1,3,5,7,#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] =
  247: 	lists:sort([X || _ := X <- Map, not is_record(X, bar)]),
  248:     [2,6] = lists:sort([A || _ := #foo{a=A} <- Map]),
  249: 
  250:     %% Call is_record/2 with illegal arguments.
  251:     [] = [X || X <- [], is_record(t, id(X))],
  252:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch [X || X <- [1], is_record(t, id(X))]),
  253: 
  254:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  255:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  256:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  257:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  258: 
  259:     %% Test optimization of is_record/3.
  260:     false = case id({a,b}) of
  261: 		{_,_}=Tuple -> is_record(Tuple, foo)
  262: 	    end,
  263:     false = case id(true) of
  264: 		true=Bool -> is_record(Bool, foo)
  265: 	    end,
  266: 
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: record_test_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  271:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  272:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6),
  273:     false = is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  274: 
  275:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5),
  276:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5),
  277:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5),
  278: 
  279:     false = is_record([], foo),
  280:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  281: 
  282:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  283:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  284:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  285:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  286: 
  287:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  288:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  289:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  290:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  291: 
  292:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo, 5)),
  293:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  294: 
  295:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  296: 
  297:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  298:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6)),
  299:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  300: 
  301:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5)),
  302:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf, 5)),
  303:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo, 5)),
  304: 
  305:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  306:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo, 5)),
  307:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf, 6)),
  308: 
  309:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo, 5)),
  310: 
  311:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo, 5)),
  312:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo, 5)),
  313: 
  314:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  315: 
  316:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  317:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  318:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  319: 
  320:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo, 5),
  321:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf, 6),
  322:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo, 5),
  323: 
  324:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  325:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  326: 
  327:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo, 5)),
  328:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo, 5)),
  329: 
  330:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  331: 
  332:     False = id(false),
  333:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo, 5) xor False),
  334:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf, 6) xor False),
  335:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo, 5) xor False ),
  336: 
  337:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo, 5) xor False),
  338:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf, 6) xor False),
  339: 
  340: 
  341:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  342: 
  343:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  344: 
  345:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  346:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  347:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  348: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar, 5)],
  349:     [1,3,5,7] =
  350: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar, 5)) and (not is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  351:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  352: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (is_record(X, foo, 5)))],
  353:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  354: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar, 5)) or (X < 5))],
  355: 
  356:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  357:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  358:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5)],
  359:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  360:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) end],
  361:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  362: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  363:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  364: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  365:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  366:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  367: 			     is_reference(X)],
  368:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  369: 				   begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  370: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  371:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  372: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  373: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  374:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  375: 			begin is_record(X, foo, 5) or is_reference(X) end],
  376:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  377: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo, 5) or
  378: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  379: 
  380:     %% Update several fields with a string literal.
  381:     #barf{} = Barf0 = id(#barf{}),
  382:     Barf = update_barf(Barf0),
  383:     #barf{a="abc",b=1} = id(Barf),
  384: 
  385:     %% Non-literal arguments.
  386:     true = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(6)),
  387:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(barf), id(42)),
  388:     false = is_record(id(#barf{}), id(foo), id(6)),
  389: 
  390:     Rec = id(#barf{}),
  391:     Good = id(barf),
  392:     Bad = id(foo),
  393:     Size = id(6),
  394: 
  395:     true = is_record(Rec, Good, Size) orelse error,
  396:     error = is_record(Rec, Bad, Size) orelse error,
  397: 
  398:     %% GH-7298: Zero size.
  399:     TupleA = id({a}),
  400: 
  401:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 0),
  402:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 0),
  403: 
  404:     ZeroF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 0) -> ok;
  405:                (_) -> error
  406:             end,
  407:     error = ZeroF(TupleA),
  408:     error = ZeroF(Bad),
  409: 
  410:     %% GH-7317: Huge tuple size used to take forever to compile.
  411:     false = is_record(TupleA, a, 10_000_000),
  412:     false = is_record(Bad, a, 10_000_000),
  413: 
  414:     HugeF = fun(A) when is_record(A, a, 10_000_000) -> ok;
  415:                (_) -> error
  416:             end,
  417:     error = HugeF(TupleA),
  418:     error = HugeF(Bad),
  419: 
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: record_access_in_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  423:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  424:     file:set_cwd(test_lib:get_data_dir(Config)),
  425:     Opts0 = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors|test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  426:     M = record_access_in_guards,
  427:  
  428:     Opts = [strict_record_tests|Opts0],
  429:     io:format("Options: ~p\n", [Opts]),
  430:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
  431:     ok = M:t(),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: 
  435: %% Test optimization of record access and is_record/2 in guards.
  436: 
  437: -record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  438: -record(r1, {a,b}).
  439: -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  440: -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  441: 
  442: guard_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  443:     ok = fun() ->
  444: 		 F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  445: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  446: 			(F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  447: 			     [H|F(F, T)];
  448: 			(_, []) -> []
  449: 		     end,
  450: 		 [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  451: 		     F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  452: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  453: 		 ok
  454: 	 end(),
  455: 
  456:     true = fun() ->
  457: 		   R = #r{},
  458: 		   if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  459: 	   end(),
  460: 
  461:     ok = fun() ->
  462: 		 F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  463: 			(false, _) -> error
  464: 		     end,
  465: 		 ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  466: 		 error = F(false, anything_goes),
  467: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  468: 		 {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  469: 		 ok
  470: 	 end(),
  471: 
  472:     ok = fun() ->
  473: 		 F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  474: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  475: 			([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  476: 			     {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  477: 			(_) -> error
  478: 		     end,
  479: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  480: 		 {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  481: 		 error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  482: 		 error = F({a,b,c}),
  483: 		 error = F([]),
  484: 		 ok
  485: 	 end(),
  486: 
  487:     ok = fun() ->
  488: 		 F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  489: 				       (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  490: 					is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  491: 			(_, _, _) -> false
  492: 		     end,
  493: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  494: 		 true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  495: 		 true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  496: 		 false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  497: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  498: 		 false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  499: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  500: 		 false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  501: 		 ok
  502: 	 end(),
  503: 
  504:     ok = fun() ->
  505: 		 F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  506: 			     {ok,R};
  507: 			(_) -> error
  508: 		     end,
  509: 		 {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  510: 		 error = F(#r{}),
  511: 		 error = F([a,b,c]),
  512: 		 ok
  513: 	 end(),
  514: 
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: update_barf(R) ->
  518:     R#barf{a="abc",b=1}.
  519: 
  520: eval_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  521:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  522: 		       true = erlang:is_record(GetRec(), foo)
  523: 	       end, #foo{}),
  524:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  525: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1}
  526: 	       end, #foo{}),
  527:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  528: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2}
  529: 	       end, #foo{}),
  530:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  531: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3}
  532: 	       end, #foo{}),
  533:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  534: 		       (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  535: 	       end, #foo{}),
  536:     ok.
  537: 
  538: once(Test, Record) ->
  539:     put(?MODULE, 0),
  540:     GetRec = fun() ->
  541: 		     put(?MODULE, 1+get(?MODULE)),
  542: 		     Record
  543: 	     end,
  544:     Result = Test(GetRec),
  545:     case get(?MODULE) of
  546: 	1 -> ok;
  547: 	N ->
  548: 	    io:format("Evaluated ~w times\n", [N]),
  549: 	    ct:fail(more_than_once)
  550:     end,
  551:     Result.
  552: 
  553: %% Thanks to Martin Bjorklund.
  554: 
  555: -record(foobar, {status}).
  556: 
  557: foobar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  558:     {ok,_,_} = x({foo, 1}),
  559:     ok.
  560: 				       
  561: get_bar() ->
  562:     #foobar{status = 1}.
  563: 
  564: x(Trans) ->
  565:     {foo, Barno} = Trans,
  566:     case get_bar() of
  567: 	Bar when Bar#foobar.status == 1 ->
  568: 	    noop(Bar),
  569: 	    Bar33 = Bar#foobar{status = 1},
  570: 	    {ok, Bar33, Barno};
  571: 	_ ->
  572: 	    Trans
  573:     end.
  574: 
  575: noop(_) ->
  576:     ok.
  577: 
  578: -record(foo_rec,
  579: 	{foo_1,
  580: 	 foo_2 = 0,
  581: 	 foo_3 = 0}).
  582: 
  583: missing_test_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     #foo_rec{foo_2=2,foo_3=5} = missing_test_heap_1(#foo_rec{foo_2=1,foo_3=4}),
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: 
  588: %% Two test_heap instructions would be incorrectly merged (not allowed
  589: %% because of gc_bif instructions for addition).
  590: missing_test_heap_1(A = #foo_rec {foo_1 = _B,
  591: 				  foo_3 = C,
  592: 				  foo_2 = D}) ->
  593:     A#foo_rec {foo_1 = {C, D},
  594:   	       foo_3 = C + 1,
  595:   	       foo_2 = D + 1}.
  596: 
  597: -record(nrec0, {name = <<"nested0">>}).
  598: -record(nrec1, {name = <<"nested1">>, nrec0=#nrec0{}}).
  599: -record(nrec2, {name = <<"nested2">>, nrec1=#nrec1{}}).
  600: 
  601: nested_access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  602:     N0 = #nrec0{},
  603:     N1 = #nrec1{},
  604:     N2 = #nrec2{},
  605:     <<"nested0">> = N0#nrec0.name,
  606:     <<"nested1">> = N1#nrec1.name,
  607:     <<"nested2">> = N2#nrec2.name,
  608:     <<"nested0">> = N1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  609:     <<"nested0">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0.name,
  610:     <<"nested1">> = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.name,
  611:     <<"nested0">> = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0.name,
  612: 
  613:     N1a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1{name = <<"nested1a">>},
  614:     <<"nested1a">> = N1a#nrec1.name,
  615: 
  616:     N2a = N2#nrec2.nrec1#nrec1.nrec0#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  617:     N2b = ((N2#nrec2.nrec1)#nrec1.nrec0)#nrec0{name = <<"nested0a">>},
  618:     <<"nested0a">> = N2a#nrec0.name,
  619:     N2a = N2b,
  620:     ok.
  621: 
  622: -record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  623: -record(fileheader, {read_md5,md5,eof,trailer}).
  624: 
  625: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  626:     %% There should only remain one record test in the code below.
  627:     R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  628:     B = R0#rr.b,				%Test the record here.
  629:     R = R0#rr{c=42},				%No need to test here.
  630:     if 
  631: 	B > R#rr.a ->				%No need to test here.
  632: 	    ok
  633:     end,
  634:     #rr{a=1,b=2,c=42} = id(R),			%Test for correctness.
  635: 
  636:     %% Cover beam_ssa_opt:ssa_opt_element/1 and friends.
  637:     error1 = check_file_header(#fileheader{read_md5=1,md5=2}),
  638:     error2 = check_file_header(#fileheader{trailer=true,eof=false}),
  639:     error3 = check_file_header(#fileheader{}),
  640: 
  641:     %% Cover sanitization of is_tagged_tuple in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  642:     {'EXIT',_} = catch id((catch 22)#rr.a),
  643: 
  644:     %% Cover beam_ssa_bool.
  645:     error = coverage_1(true),
  646: 
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: check_file_header(FH) ->
  650:     if
  651:         FH#fileheader.read_md5 =/= FH#fileheader.md5 ->
  652:             error1;
  653:         FH#fileheader.trailer =/= FH#fileheader.eof ->
  654:             error2;
  655:         true ->
  656:             error3
  657:     end.
  658: 
  659: coverage_1(V) when false#rr.b; V, "abc" ->
  660:     ok;
  661: coverage_1(_) ->
  662:     error.
  663: 
  664: -record(default_fun, {a = fun(X) -> X*X end}).
  665: 
  666: %% compiler treats records with 1 and 2 fields differently...
  667: -record(gb_nil, {}).
  668: -record(gb_foo, {hello=1}).
  669: -record(gb_bar, {hello=2,there=3}).
  670: -record(gb_rh, {mod,mid}).
  671: 
  672: %% Taken from compilation_SUITE and other places.
  673: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  674:     T1 = fun() ->
  675: 		 X = #foo{},
  676: 		 Y = #foo{},
  677: 		 {X#foo.a == Y#foo.a,X#foo.b}
  678: 	 end,
  679:     {true,undefined} = T1(),
  680: 
  681:     T2 = fun(X, Y) ->
  682: 		 first_arg(X#foo.a =/= Y#foo.a, X#foo.b =/= X#foo.b)
  683: 	 end,
  684:     true = T2(#foo{a=x,b=z}, #foo{a=y,b=z}),
  685: 
  686:     T3 = fun() ->
  687: 		 #default_fun{a=Fun} = id(#default_fun{}),
  688: 		 9 = Fun(3)
  689: 	 end,
  690:     T3(),
  691: 
  692:     %% Stupid code, but the compiler used to crash.
  693:     T4 = fun() ->
  694: 		 F0 = fun() ->
  695: 			      R1 = #gb_nil{},
  696: 			      R2 = R1#gb_nil{},
  697: 			      R1 = R2
  698: 		      end,
  699: 		 F1 = fun() ->
  700: 			      R1 = #gb_foo{},
  701: 			      R2 = R1#gb_foo{},
  702: 			      R1 = R2
  703: 		      end,
  704: 
  705: 		 F2 = fun() ->
  706: 			      R1 = #gb_bar{},
  707: 			      R2 = R1#gb_bar{},
  708: 			      R1 = R2
  709: 		      end,
  710: 		 F0(),
  711: 		 F1(),
  712: 		 F2()
  713: 	 end,
  714:     T4(),
  715: 
  716:     %% Used to crash beam_ssa_bool during its development.
  717:     T5 = fun(RH) ->
  718:                  if
  719:                      is_record(RH, gb_rh) andalso
  720:                      is_atom(RH#gb_rh.mod) andalso
  721:                      RH#gb_rh.mid /= 42 -> ok;
  722:                      true -> error
  723:                  end
  724:          end,
  725:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{}),
  726:     ok = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=0}),
  727:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=100,mid=0}),
  728:     error = T5(#gb_rh{mod=atom,mid=42}),
  729:     error = T5(#gb_nil{}),
  730:     error = T5(#gb_bar{}),
  731:     error = T5(atom),
  732: 
  733:     %% With type optimizations disabled, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would insert
  734:     %% set_tuple_element instructions between the call to setelement/3 and
  735:     %% its succeeded instruction.
  736:     T6 = fun(R) ->
  737:                  try
  738:                      %% The succeeded instruction should immediately follow its instruction.
  739:                      %% Not like this:
  740:                      %%
  741:                      %%   x0/_212 = call (`erlang`:`setelement`/3), `5`, y0/_87:37, `4`
  742:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:34 = set_tuple_element `3`, x0/_212, `3`
  743:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:35 = set_tuple_element `2`, x0/_212, `2`
  744:                      %%   z0/@ssa_dummy:36 = set_tuple_element `1`, x0/_212, `1`
  745:                      %%   z0/@ssa_bool:13 = succeeded x0/_212
  746:                      %%   br z0/@ssa_bool:13, ^14, ^4
  747:                      R#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  748:                  of
  749:                      42 ->
  750:                          ok
  751:                  catch
  752:                      _:_ ->
  753:                          error
  754:                  end
  755:          end,
  756:     error = catch T6(100),
  757:     error = catch T6([a,b,c]),
  758:     error = catch T6(#bar{}),
  759:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,#foo{}},_}} = catch T6(#foo{}),
  760: 
  761:     ok.
  762: 
  763: %% ERIERL-436; the following code used to be very slow to compile.
  764: %%
  765: %% #slow_r{} should have about 4x as many fields for the test to be effective
  766: %% (all of them matched in slow_compilation/1), but unfortunately the memory
  767: %% use scales together with the speed so we'll run out of memory on many of
  768: %% our test machines before we reach noticeable levels (2+ minutes before the
  769: %% fix).
  770: %%
  771: %% We've therefore scaled it down to the current level, at least it it'll guard
  772: %% against excessive regressions.
  773: 
  774: -record(slow_r,
  775:         {f0,  f1, f2, f3, f4, f5, f6, f7, f8, f9,
  776:          f10,f11,f12,f13,f14,f15,f16,f17,f18,f19,
  777:          f20,f21,f22,f23,f24,f25,f26,f27,f28,f29,
  778:          f30,f31,f32,f33,f34,f35,f36,f37,f38,f39,
  779:          f40,f41,f42,f43,f44,f45,f46,f47,f48,f49,
  780:          f50,f51,f52,f53,f54,f55,f56,f57,f58,f59}).
  781: 
  782: slow_compilation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  783:     R = id(#slow_r{}),
  784: 
  785:     [{f0,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f0},{f1,R#slow_r.f1},
  786:      {f2,R#slow_r.f2},{f3,R#slow_r.f3},{f4,R#slow_r.f4},
  787:      {f5,R#slow_r.f5},{f6,R#slow_r.f6},{f7,R#slow_r.f7},
  788:      {f8,R#slow_r.f8},{f9,R#slow_r.f9},{f10,R#slow_r.f10},
  789:      {f11,R#slow_r.f11},{f12,R#slow_r.f12},{f13,R#slow_r.f13},
  790:      {f14,R#slow_r.f14},{f15,R#slow_r.f15},{f16,R#slow_r.f16},
  791:      {f17,R#slow_r.f17},{f18,R#slow_r.f18},{f19,R#slow_r.f19},
  792:      {f20,R#slow_r.f20},{f21,R#slow_r.f21},{f22,R#slow_r.f22},
  793:      {f23,R#slow_r.f23},{f24,R#slow_r.f24},{f25,R#slow_r.f25},
  794:      {f26,R#slow_r.f26},{f27,R#slow_r.f27},{f28,R#slow_r.f28},
  795:      {f29,R#slow_r.f29},{f30,R#slow_r.f30},{f31,R#slow_r.f31},
  796:      {f32,R#slow_r.f32},{f33,R#slow_r.f33},{f34,R#slow_r.f34},
  797:      {f35,R#slow_r.f35},{f36,R#slow_r.f36},{f37,R#slow_r.f37},
  798:      {f38,R#slow_r.f38},{f39,R#slow_r.f39},{f40,R#slow_r.f40},
  799:      {f41,R#slow_r.f41},{f42,R#slow_r.f42},{f43,R#slow_r.f43},
  800:      {f44,R#slow_r.f44},{f45,R#slow_r.f45},{f46,R#slow_r.f46},
  801:      {f47,R#slow_r.f47},{f48,R#slow_r.f48},{f49,R#slow_r.f49},
  802:      {f40,R#slow_r.f50},{f51,R#slow_r.f51},{f52,R#slow_r.f52},
  803:      {f53,R#slow_r.f53},{f54,R#slow_r.f54},{f55,R#slow_r.f55},
  804:      {f56,R#slow_r.f56},{f57,R#slow_r.f57},{f58,R#slow_r.f58},
  805:      {f59,R#slow_r.f59}].
  806: 
  807: first_arg(First, _) -> First.
  808: 
  809: id(I) -> I.
